title: Obnoxious family taking up entire supermarket aisle refuse to move, so guy helps himself to whatever is in their cart: ‘A breech of supermarket etiquette… was justified'
description: Grocery shopping is not for the weak of heart. Perhaps if you live somewhere that isn't too populated and you can go at some random hour of the day, then fine, yes, it is probably very peaceful for you. But for the rest of us who only has time to go grocery shopping during the hours that everyone else has to go, it is stressful. The aisles are full, check-out lines are long, and have of the things on your list are sold out. It's frustrating and overwhelming. So you try to stay focused, bring a shopping list, and go on your own or with one other partner to help out—any more and it becomes extra stressful.  No imagine you go during shopping rush hour and you decide to bring you partner, kids, in-laws, cousins, and kids' friends. What?… Why?? Why would you do that? What is the point?? All that is going to do is cause extra stress for you, because now you are a host/babysitter, and you are just adding even more to the shopping rush hour that makes shoppers so overwhelmed. And yet, people actually do that, and stand in aisle like it's their own living room…
author: Elna McHilderson
excerpt: Obnoxious family taking up entire supermarket aisle refuse to move, so guy helps himself to whatever is in their cart: ‘A breech of supermarket etiquette… was justified' - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: In this instance, a loyal boyfriend was on a mission to get his girlfriend some croissants. He noticed a very large family blocking his way to the item he needed, so he decided to do the rest of his shopping first. However, when he returned, they were still there, taking up the entire aisle, not letting anyone pass. He decided to go through another aisle to get around them, but when he finally got there, they grabbed the last bag of croissants right in front of his face. Instead of accepting defeat, he barreled his way through the entitled family, and secretly snatched the bag of croissants on his way through. He might have broke supermarket etiquette, but it seemed justified in this situation…
